arm_group.description: T0 - intervention over 4 weeks with stochastic resonance whole-body vibration (SR-WBV) (start with 3 up to 6 Hz, noise 4) T1 - intervention 4 weeks (SR-WBV (start with 3 up to 6Hz, noise 4 & virtual games) - T2
T0 - intervention 4 weeks (SR-WBV 1 Hz, noise 1) - T1 - intervention 4 weeks (SR-WBV 1 Hz, noise 1 & Aktiv Tramp) - T2

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this randomized controlled study was to examine the effects of a 8 weeks
      innovative training regime (stochastic resonance whole-body vibration [SR-WBV] and virtual
      virtual games [VG]) in the skilling up phase on physical performance, strength and cognition
      in an frail elderly population.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Performance Classification for Elderly: Innovative Training Program for Frail Elderly Individuals

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is based on the physical performance classification for elderly (PPCfE). The
      PPCfE was determining by the total score of the short physical performance battery (SPPB).
      Status (pre-)frail: 0 - 6 points; status mobile: 7 - 10 points; status trained: 11 - 12
      points.

      Sensorimotor and strength exercise are methods to increase strength & power in the field of
      geriatrics. The question that arise what exercises are best suited to and most effective for
      (pre-)frail elderly individuals. Such populations are advised first to enter a "skilling up
      program" before more traditional forms of training exercises are implemented.

      Goals in the skilling up phase: improvement in neuromuscular control, postural control and
      strengthening of large muscle groups of the lower extremity.

      The aim of the study in the skilling up phase:

      Study the effect on physical performance Study the effects on muscle strength. Study the
      effects on cognition. The participants will be recruited in Canton Bern - Swizerland and
      will be randomly allocated to an intervention group or sham group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  RAI (Resident Assessment Instrument) >0

          -  live in canton Bern

          -  in terms of training load be resistant.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  acut joint disease, acut thrombosis, acute fractures, acute infections, acute tissue
             damage, or acute

          -  surgical scars

          -  seniors with prosthesis.

          -  alcoholic

          -  acute joint disease, activated osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, acute lower limb

          -  acute inflammation or infection tumors

          -  fresh surgical wounds

          -  severe migraine

          -  epilepsy acute severe pain

intervention.description: Participants will undergo a training program set over eight weeks, three times a week with 3 to 6 Hz, Noise 4.
Participants will undergo a training program set from week 5 to 8, three times a week over 20 minutes.
Participants will undergo a training program set over eight weeks three times a week with 1 Hz, Noise 1.
Participants will undergo a training program set from the 5 to 8 week, three times a week with 1Hz.

clinical_study.official_title: Skilling-up Exercise for Prefrail and Frail Nursing Home Dwellers

overall_official.affiliation: Bern University of Applied Science, Department WGS

primary_outcome.description: Short physical performance battery (SPBB): The SPBB examines 3 areas of lower extremity function: standing balance (semi-tandem stand, side-by-side stand, full tandem stand), usual walking speed and ability to stand from a chair. These areas represent essential tasks important for independent living.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated by isometric MCV at 90 degree angle in the knee joint.

The trail-making test is a neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching. The task requires a subject to 'connect-the-dots' of 25 consecutive targets on a sheet of paper. Two versions are available: A, in which the targets are all numbers (1,2,3, etc.), and B, in which the subject alternates between numbers and letters (1, A, 2, B, etc.). The goal of the subject is to finish the test as quickly as possible, and the time taken to complete the test is used as the primary performance metric.
The shortened version of the falls efficacy scale-international (FES-I): assess fear of falling.
It will be evaluated by isometric RFD at 90 degree angle in the knee joint.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
